dunGen

Class Module

  • java.lang.Object
    • dunGen.Module
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.event.Listener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Passageway, Room

    public abstract class Module
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.bukkit.event.Listener
    A base class representing a physical model in minecraft. It is loaded from a schematic file and placed according to the information given there.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  Module.Connector
      Wraps the info on entry and exit of this module, e.g. direction and dimensions.
      static class  Module.ModuleType

    • Constructor Detail

      • Module

        public Module(DunGen parent,
              java.lang.String name,
              com.sk89q.worldedit.Vector targetL,
              Helper.Direc towardsD)
        Contructs the new module object and initializes it by reading its 'name'.yml file.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent Plugin for member access
        name - The name of this module, as well as .schematic and .yml files
        targetL - The location of the entry as global vector (lower left free(air or door) block)
        towardsD - Direction the dungeon is facing (inwards)

    • Method Detail

      • getConfig

        public static org.bukkit.configuration.file.YamlConfiguration getConfig(DunGen parent,
                                                                        java.lang.String name)
        Static method to get a modules config alone, returns null if failed. The loading is tested during the initial yml test and should therefore work during DunGen runtime.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent plugin
        name - The modules name for witch the config should be loaded (file 'name'.yml)
        Returns:
        The config object. Returns null if errors occured and sets plugin state to ERROR.

      • getType

        public static Module.ModuleType getType(DunGen parent,
                                        java.lang.String name)
        Static method to get a moduel type before constructor has been executed. Config loading is tested during initial yml test and is not catched here.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent plugin, needed for config loading.
        name - The name of the module.
        Returns:
        The ModuleType enum with the value for this name.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Fills the bounding box occupied by this module with air. To be implemented: actual restoring of the destroyed landscape. This would need one clipboard per module.

      • getNextEntryPos

        public com.sk89q.worldedit.Vector getNextEntryPos()
        Return the the next block after the exit (where the next module global origin should be placed)

      • getPlugin

        public DunGen getPlugin()
        Returns the plugin.

      • loadConfig

        public void loadConfig()
        Loads all basic properties common for every module. The initial yml check makes sure all properties are already in there. This superclass function has to be called by every subclass upon loading its own config!

      • place

        public void place()
        Places the module by loading it from its associated .schematic file. Does shifting and rotation according to the values given during object construction and conf loading. Also invokes the prePlacementActions() and postPlacementActions() accordingly. The used CuboidClipboard is saved for later use.

      • postPlacementActions

        public abstract void postPlacementActions()
        Stuff done automatically and immediatelly after placement is to be specified here.

      • prePlacementActions

        public abstract void prePlacementActions()
        Stuff done while not yet placed, but obejct and clipboad exist.

      • register

        public abstract void register()
        Activation of listeners or scheduled tasks.

      • toGlobal

        public com.sk89q.worldedit.Vector toGlobal(com.sk89q.worldedit.Vector relativePt)
        Converts the module's relative coordinates to global points (possible only after placement!)
        Parameters:
        relativePt - A relative position, measured from the module origin, facing EAST.
        Returns:
        A global position, according to where and in which rotation this module was placed, null if called before placement.

      • toRelative

        public com.sk89q.worldedit.Vector toRelative(com.sk89q.worldedit.Vector globalPt)
        Converts global world coordinates to the relative coordinate frame of this module, only valid after placement!
        Parameters:
        globalPt - A global world position.
        Returns:
        A relative position, measured from the module origin, facing EAST. Calculated according to placement and rotation.

      • unregister

        public abstract void unregister()
        Deactivation of listeners and scheduled tasks
